Package view

Class View

java.lang.Object
view.View
public class View
extends java.lang.Object
View of the application. Called by the controller to display information in console.

    • printMenu

    • printObjectUsage

      public void printObjectUsage​(java.lang.String object)
      Prints the usage of an action.
      Parameters:
      object - object for which we want to print the usage (ex: user, borrowing or storage). For an equipment object, use printEquipmentUsage().

    • askPositiveInt

      public int askPositiveInt​(java.lang.String message)
      Asks a positive integer to the user, with a given message.
      Parameters:
      message - a message which is going to be printed before asking an integer to the user.
      Returns:
      if valid, the integer given by the user, else -1.

    • getAction

      public java.lang.String[] getAction()
      Asks an action (display, add, delete, update, return, quit) from the user, realised on a object (user, storage, equipment, borrowing).
      Returns:
      an array of string containing actions entered by the user.

    • display

      public void display​(java.lang.Object object)
      Displays an object
      Parameters:
      object - object to print.

    • getUserInput

      public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getUserInput()
      Get inputs from the user.
      Returns:
      an array of string containing strings entered by the user.

    • printEquipmentUsage

      public void printEquipmentUsage​(int type)
      Print usage depending on the equipment type.
      Parameters:
      type - type of the equipment for which we want to print the usage.

    • askDisplayType

      public int askDisplayType​(java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> choices, java.lang.String message)
      Asks how the user want to display the data.
      Parameters:
      choices - list of valid choices.
      message - message to print before asking an input from the user.
      Returns:
      the choice of the user.

    • printHashMap

      public void printHashMap​(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Integer,​?> map)
      Prints a dictionary.
      Parameters:
      map - the dictionary to print.

      Asks the state of an equipment to the user.
